misdeed: A string of brutal murders has left a remote village reeling. The victims are found mangled beyond recognition, bearing deep lacerations and as if torn apart by a wild animal. Fear and suspicion run rampant as the full moon approaches.
solution: The Vaesen is a Werewolf and can be killed by being struck with a silver weapon while Broken, freed from its curse by being called by its true name under the light of a full moon, or can break the curse itself by devouring a human baby.

clues.description: The killings occur sporadically, but always under the light of the full moon, escalating in brutality with each passing month.
The villagers whisper of a curse, passed down through generations, that transforms a human into a bloodthirsty beast under the influence of the lunar cycle.
Footprints found near the crime scenes suggest a creature with both human and animalistic characteristics, its gait shifting between two-legged and four-legged strides.
A local hunter discovers a piece of torn clothing snagged on a branch near one of the crime scenes, identified as belonging to a reclusive but well-respected villager.
As the full moon rises, villagers report hearing haunting howls echoing through the night, sending chills down their spines.
A silver locket, engraved with a wolf’s head and containing a lock of the suspected villager’s hair, is discovered hidden in the rafters of their home.

plotTwist.description: The village blacksmith, burdened by a dark family secret and fearing he will succumb to the curse himself, has been secretly protecting the villagers from the Vaesen.
